item.title: Pod People taking over…
item.dc:creator: AC
item.description: “It is generally agreed that teens have abandoned conventional radio in favour of other audio platforms including peer-to-peer file sharing, music downloading and iPods,” says the CAB, which represents Canada’s radio companies.
item.content:encoded: “It is generally agreed that teens have abandoned conventional radio in favour of other audio platforms including peer-to-peer file sharing, music downloading and iPods,” says the CAB, which represents Canada’s radio companies.

item.title: CC on the Case
item.dc:creator: AC
item.description: CC Canada: “The Dutch Court’s decision is especially noteworthy because it confirms that the conditions of a Creative Commons license automatically apply to the content licensed under it, and bind users of such content even without expressly agreeing to, or having knowledge of, the conditions of the license.”
item.content:encoded: CC Canada: “The Dutch Court’s decision is especially noteworthy because it confirms that the conditions of a Creative Commons license automatically apply to the content licensed under it, and bind users of such content even without expressly agreeing to, or having knowledge of, the conditions of the license.”

item.title: Christina’s Catwalk Debut
item.dc:creator: AC
item.description:
copyright Helene Wiesenhaan (+31(0)651108234)
Despite some of the ‘us and them’ talk about professional photographers and publications, it’s easy to get along. Helene Wiesenhaan took this pic of Christina’s debut last night and has graciously allowed me to post it under her copyright. I told her I’d pass the $1200 [...]
item.content:encoded:
copyright Helene Wiesenhaan (+31(0)651108234)

Despite some of the ‘us and them’ talk about professional photographers and publications, it’s easy to get along.

Helene Wiesenhaan took this pic of Christina’s debut last night and has graciously allowed me to post it under her copyright. I told her I’d pass the $1200 fine on to her if it gets ’stolen’

item.title: Christina on the Catwalk
item.dc:creator: AC
item.description: Yesterday Christina made her debut on the catwalk for Paul Schulten couture in the netherlands. She had fun, looked beautiful and here’s some video.
item.content:encoded: Yesterday Christina made her debut on the catwalk for Paul Schulten couture in the netherlands. She had fun, looked beautiful and here’s some video.

item.title: Hotel Access
item.dc:creator: AC
item.description: After paying $35 per 24 hour period, I really hated seeing this message after a scan for the latest ‘casts: Swisscom Eurospot is keen to offer the best service to their customers, work actively against piracy (peer to peer music and movie downloads) and email spamming. In order to do that, we have set traffic limitations [...]
item.content:encoded:
After paying $35 per 24 hour period, I really hated seeing this message after a scan for the latest ‘casts:

Swisscom Eurospot is keen to offer the best service to their customers, work actively against piracy (peer to peer music and movie downloads) and email spamming. In order to do that, we have set traffic limitations to our internet access codes.For example following limitations have been applied: 50MB for 30 minutes, 100 MB for 2 hours, 250 MB for 24 hours, 1 GB for 7 days and 2 GB for 30 days. All these limitations are download limitations, the upload being limited to around 1/4 of the download.

wtf? Do spammers and ‘pirates’ regularly use hotel rooms to operate out of? Can hardly imagine that.
